text: you might be able to hack one together using a form that doesn't require an email and a custom contact property. if you can get use the contact that doesn't have any email associated with it and then used a personalization token to output that field.... probably a terrible idea
would be better to use HubDB and your own server to write to it since you can't write to it from inside HubL
on click it sends a PUT request to your server which then writes to hubdb to add 1. should be fairly simple
can somebody run all the SVGs that get output with the `icon` field through SVGO to remove all the duplicated ID issues it causes? :pray:
is there a way to use modules in for loops? running into weird id / not unique instance names
Have you tried incorporating the loop index into the name of the module?
The name of the module `{% module "name" %}` has to be unique
Had anyone ever build a timeline module for a landing page on HS? I’m just wondering if there’s something I can use as base. Thanks in advance

in <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates#parameters-available-for-all-modules|module parameters> I finally found `unique_in_loop` . I had remembered reading something like this, but when I searched in the CMS docs for “unique in loop”, all that showed up was api endpoints
I stumbled upon it by accident after I asked the question above lol
Yeah, I used hubdb for the fields. Then the module’s `hubdb` field type to get the data
Another approach I’ve used in the past, is to use a module with a repeater field or field group <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview#repeaters>
Yep, if it’s under 15 dates the module route may be the best option
